page.title: 10Bickham House (2).
page.content: There are 23 rooms in the house, three less than originally. These three having been replaced by two additional staircases.The most recent addition is a cottage converted from the original outhouses. Although the exterior of the house is of interest the interior is not historically important. The house used to have five servants and a complete maintenance team but now only one daily help is employed together with a cook for two days a week and two decorators. The gardens are open to the public every Sunday in April, May and early June. Proceeds from the entrance fee of 50p are donated to charity. Over the last three years a lace exhibition has become an annual event. Parties may also be held by special appointment.
